title: Deep Learning-based Intraoperative MRI Reconstruction. (arXiv:2401.12771v1 [eess.IV])
abstract: Purpose: To evaluate the quality of deep learning reconstruction for prospectively accelerated intraoperative magnetic resonance imaging (iMRI) during resective brain tumor surgery.  Materials and Methods: Accelerated iMRI was performed during brain surgery using dual surface coils positioned around the area of resection. A deep learning (DL) model was trained on the fastMRI neuro dataset to mimic the data from the iMRI protocol. Evaluation was performed on imaging material from 40 patients imaged between 01.11.2021 - 01.06.2023 that underwent iMRI during tumor resection surgery. A comparative analysis was conducted between the conventional compressed sense (CS) method and the trained DL reconstruction method. Blinded evaluation of multiple image quality metrics was performed by two working neuro-radiologists and a working neurosurgeon on a 1 to 5 Likert scale (1=non diagnostic, 2=poor, 3=acceptable, 4=good, 5=excellent), and the favored reconstruction variant.  Results: The DL reconst

translated_title: 基于深度学习的术中磁共振成像重建
translated_abstract: 目的：评估深度学习重建用于术中磁共振成像（iMRI）在脑肿瘤手术中的质量。材料和方法：在脑手术中使用放置在切除区域周围的双表面线圈进行加速iMRI。使用fastMRI神经数据集训练了一个深度学习（DL）模型，以模拟iMRI协议的数据。评估了40名在2021年11月1日至2023年6月1日期间进行脑肿瘤切除手术期间进行iMRI的患者的成像材料。在传统的压缩感知（CS）方法和训练过的DL重建方法之间进行了比较分析。两位神经放射科医师和一位神经外科医生以1至5的Likert量表（1=非诊断、2=差、3=可接受、4=好、5=优秀）进行了盲评估，并选择最佳的重建变体。
tldr: 本研究评估了基于深度学习的术中磁共振成像重建方法在脑肿瘤手术中的质量，并与传统的压缩感知方法进行了比较。结果表明，深度学习重建方法在质量上表现优异。
en_tdlr: This study evaluated the quality of deep learning-based intraoperative MRI reconstruction for brain tumor surgery and compared it with conventional compressed sensing methods. The results showed that the deep learning reconstruction method performed excellently in terms of quality.
